Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: During our two-week trip around the island this is the only spot we elected to stay two night in a row. There's plenty to do in the neighborhood - swimming, snorkeling, hikes in the national forest, boat trips. Furthermore it's a clean part of the country. We liked the villages. The room at the parador was very clean and a nice view from the veranda. The pool was our favorite of our trip. We got to know several of the staff and found them to be well-trained, courteous, knowledgeable, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Full of history and good to spend the night for a romantic getaway...”
Reviews.Author: Edwin_Almodovar
Reviews.Content: Parador Guanica 1929 was an old sugar mill "Hacienda" restore as a Parador (Hotel). It has an antique flavor to it, so dont expect a lot of accomodations. Although it is comfy, if you are lucky and get a nice cool night, you will definetely enjoy the surroundings. El parador is right off route 116, very accessible and easy to get. The entrance is quite impressive with a large fountain and magnificent trees. They do offer a good breakfast and meals. The service was great and folks are very hospitable. I checked in with the security guard as I arrived after hours, but they definetely earned a 5 star on service the night we checked in. I stayed with my wife for a romantic getaway, and we truly enjoyed it. It wasn't overprized as management offers some good deals on the weekdays. The price on a weekend is another story. It is one of those experiences that you have to live to tell your own tale. For us it was a pleasant one. It is a good place to get away from the overprized run city hotel rooms, or beach houses in the area. Plus, you get to see the country side of Puerto Rico. If it is for a couple and you want to get a taste of the 1930's, I will recommend it. For a family with kids, for a stay of two nights or more, I would considered other options before going back to Guanica 1929.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parador Stay”
Reviews.Author: opps5
Reviews.Content: This parador is now part of a hotel/restaurant training school. It was the first time we stayed there but we found everything very lovely. The staff was extra helpful, the room was large with microwave, coffee maker and refrig. Had breakfast every day and it was always good. Ate dinner there twice and found the food very good. Combined with a reasonable price, it is a very good bargain. The swimming pool was warm and very clean but you need your own pool towels or buy from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: ElViajero88
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight with my family earlier this month and really enjoyed my visit. The hammocks under the trees to the right side of the property were very relaxing. The time I spent in the pier in the evening was magical. The staff went out of their way to make sure they could accommodate a family member with limited mobility on short notice. The handicapped accessible room was very clean and comfortable although the shower could have a bit better drainage to avoid spilling so much water on the rest of the bathroom. The food in the restaurant was good and only let down a little by an order that wasn't served as requested. I accidentally left behind a battery charger for my camera and the staff made sure to store it securely until we could arrange to pick it up at a later date. Something for which I am very grateful. As a history enthusiast I appreciate the fact that the property has been restored to it's original purpose as a hotel (originally part of the company town supporting the Guanica sugar mill). That however, means that it sits in a mangrove so if you are looking or a place where you can step out of the room and walk to a sandy beach, this may not be the place for you. There are many wonderful beaches a relatively sort distance however, making this hotel a great jump off point for many activities on the Southwest corner of the island. I am looking forward to a future stay on my next visit to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SeanT198
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice pool (maybe a little on the small side), relaxing views and surroundings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was good. Room was a nice size, only problems were the AC unit blew right on the bed and we were unable to adjust the temp or fan speed and the toilet would run until you "jiggle the handle."

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean”
Reviews.Author: HojasRojas
Reviews.Content: The building and grounds are beautiful. Close by Gilligan's island and the Dry Forest. The corner room on the second floor was small and tired but the bed was comfortable and clean. There didn't seem to be much hot water in the morning for a shower. We didn't use the pool but it looked nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the staff were friendly. The check in could have been alot smoother and the front desk staff were not that helpful with info about kayaking in the area. Wi-fi only worked near the reception. There are hammocks on the grounds that unfortunately were wet. A nice addition would be to hang a few hammocks on the balconies near the guest rooms. Overall this was ok for one night for the price ($100) but I would not stay for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Struggling Parador in Guanica”
Reviews.Author: rroblan07
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at this parador ("Tropocal Inn they call it). The rooms are average, no fancy features, TV has a few channels (1 or 2 in english), all furniture is old, the place looks old but is kept clean, meaning no crawling insects that we could see. The air conditioner worked great which is a must due to the high humidity and mosquitoes in the area. Bathroom was remodeled and adequate with the usual giveaways and clean linen. There is a small gym that nobody uses, a nice swimming pool (the highlight of the place) but no other outdoor activity areas. The premises are located by the seashore but there is no beach, not even nearby boating facilities, you have to go to Gilligan's Island for that (ask around). The dining room is better than expected, great service but food is average at best. Never ate anything other than breakfast. Our room was not ready (we got there before check-in time) but they offered us one anyway which they had just cleaned, DON'T DO THAT! They use a heavy duty cleaner with an awful smell and it takes several hours for the smell to fade away, even at night there was a strong odor, but bearable. This is by no means your standard two or three star mainland hotel, but if you are looking for reasonable rates and a location in the PORTA DEL SOL area, you are in the right place. Don't go to nearby La Parguera Inns, they are sorry over-rated places. The overall service at the Guanica Parador was great and they will try to accommodate your wishes if they can. And there is an adjacent wine & music place for adult entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Scullyster
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Parador Guanica. But note that this hotel is not for everyone. The room was spacious and clean. It was on the second floor and there is no elevator or bellhops to help with bags, which was fine with us. However, If you have trouble with stairs, ask for a ground floor room. There is a very nice swimming pool that children were enjoying. The room cost includes meals, which is good because there are not a lot of places to eat good food nearby. The food was good but the dessert flan was the worst flan I have ever eaten. They do not have a liquor license - something about being too close to the church across the street. So, if you like to imbibe, be sure to bring your own. The dining room has a dark and claustrophobic feel so we chose to eat outside on the porch. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel has the ambience of bygone days. It is set on a former sugar operation of some kind and there are refurbished cane benches all around. The landscaping of the property is not manicured but interesting with some huge, old trees. At sunset, the mosquitoes came out in droves. So bring bug repellant. There is a small playground for kids. I recommend this hotel to families with kids. There was nothing to do after dinner so I wouldn't recommend this hotel to persons traveling solo.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: usually_happy64
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place. I was a little worried because, while most reviews were favorable, a few complained of a â€œmoldy stenchâ€�. This was absolutely not so. In fact, upon thinking about it, it would be difficult to have mold in the rooms, since the Parador is located in the dry area of Puerto Rico. We found the staff extremely helpful, never failing to fill our needs. For instance, we found the room exceedingly cold and could not change the air conditioner setting. When we spoke to the person in the office, she explained that they have the settings locked down and we could not change itâ€¦but she would be happy too. She came to our room and did adjust the temperature to our liking. We also found that our shower was not working properly and reported it late at night. The next day they did fix the shower and it was fine. We thought the room was exceedingly small and were surprised that some people we met there did not agree with us. We checked out their room, they had two full beds with plenty of room to walk around. We had a king in, what must have been, a smaller room. There was not extra room. I suggest that you request a room with two full beds. That is what we intend to do when we return next year. And we will return because: the cost was extremely fair, the breakfasts (which we pre-purchased) were hot and satisfying, the staff was accommodating. We did meet people without a car and they were stuck, because this place in not within walking distance to anything, restaurants, beaches, parksâ€¦nothing. But if you have a car it is just a short drive to the dry forest, Gillians Islandâ€™s boats, Guanica.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MAL2pr
Reviews.Content: We loved evrything the food, the room, the service and most The Price. Lots of stuff to do around Guanica. Beautiful beaches, restaurants, kayaking, boat rides thru rivers and channels... Simply a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Small/Cozy. Moderately priced. Lots of places to go around.”
Reviews.Author: tmathews_82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days. The rooms were pretty small but who spends time in the room during vacation? Just a place to hang your hat. Meals were good, but not great. Adequate to get you going in the morning and at lunch. Very good service in restaurant. WiFi does not work except by front office. Bring a cable. Can't control air conditioning temperature.... seriously. Hot water was far from hot, but manageable. The Bodegas Andreu winery next door is worth the quality of the rooms though. They are open Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Excellent wine and food. Great views. Great music.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay there again...very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: sicilianstarlet
Reviews.Content: The hotel from the outside was gorgeous, and the pool and view was nice too. They were also nice enough to let us check in early, at 7AM, since we arrived so early. However, the rooms were a big disappointment. The rooms are very small, and have a moldy stench to them, especially the bathroom. The outlet in the bathroom was not working, therefore I had to plug the hairdryer and straightening iron in the outlet by the TV, so we had to unplug the TV and microwave, which made it very difficult to do my hair without a mirror. They said they would send someone to repair it, but never did. The only other outlet available was by the bed, but it was being used by the lamp and alarm clock. We had to unplug those in order to charge our phones, so we had no lamp and alarm clock. Our phone was also not working, which they also said they would send someone to repair it and never did. There was no outlet to plug the coffee machine in either, since everything was being used before we even started plugging our stuff in. They didnt give enough towels in the bathroom. The only way to control the AC was an on/off button. There was no way of adjusting the temperature. So we would turn it on and off every 10 minutes literally, because it would get too cold in there very fast, but it would become very humid if it was off for longer than 10-15 minutes. There was no fitted sheet on the bed. Instead it was just a regular sheet tucked under the mattress, which wasn't long enough to cover the whole mattress. About 8 inches at the end of the mattress was exposed, which you would feel when you got into bed. So we had to take a sheet from the other bed and cover it, because the mattress was not that great looking, let alone how rough it felt on our feet. Another thing about the shower, there is only a tiny little soap dish in there. Everything else we used in the shower had to be put on the floor. The hair dryer even had an old moldy smell coming out of it. All in all, it was a great location for us, since it was close to where we wanted to be. But I would not choose to stay here again if I go back to PR. I would rather pay a little more money (even though this hotel was not cheap), and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Small Moldy Soul-less Concrete Cubicles in a beautiful building.”
Reviews.Author: jalwww
Reviews.Content: If you are Mold or Fungus sensitive - avoid this place. I don't think it is so much from the building but from the A/C. I felt awful the next day - we left early and forfeited our money. The A/C system works with the key card (WHY?) and ours did not work well - no matter how high we adjusted it it was freezing (we had it on 84 F and the room was 68) These kind of houses (by second cousin lived in one) had generous rooms - The Parador Guanica has been remodeled (poorly) so the rooms are smaller - think motel. Bare walls, no attempt to make it "authentic" other than the Cast Iron Headboards (As uncomfortable as it sounds), just a box with painted walls and cheap art. Rooms 111, 214 & 219 (sorry I did not note all the rooms like this) have tiny windows - Ours was locked - no way to open it. Privacy glass top to bottom was a bit much and added to the claustrophobic feel that the room had. Service was fair, food was fair, coffee was fair for US standards (poor for PR standards) The towels were small and rough, and too few (but we asked for more and they brought them) The hotel is part of a vocational school, for the hotel industry . The bay is not the prettiest, but we did see a Manta Ray (or small skate?) off the piers. Overall it was lackluster and disappointing, I am not sure why it gets such good reviews. There are better places to stay -Mary Lee's by the Sea, or in La Parguera (which also has a Parador), and it certainly was not good value. Fitness Center: One Treadmill, one bike and a mutli-machine that is so loose it is dangerous. The pool was nice. Vending machines with the usual fare. If you want to get away from it all, are impervious to mold and mildew, could care less about interior ambiance and don't mind spending money, then this place might just work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: There were many enjoyable things about our stay. The rooms were nicely kept, though the window was very small and didn't afford a great view of anything. Walking to the dock affords much better views of the beautiful bay. The beds were very comfortable, and a fridge was provided in the room. I was also able to connect to the wireless internet, though it may not be available in all rooms. The breakfast was included with the rate that we purchased (it may not be for everybody), and it was worth it. They provide a considerable amount of food, and many different choices, including drinks. It was very pleasant to be able to sit outside on the patio area. The swimming pool area was also beautiful, and it was nice to enjoy the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Dasim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well kept the 4ft pool is nice and family friendly. The room are a little small but have good airconditioners to keep the room cool. There is a refrigerator, coffee maker & microwave for food in the rooms which is very nice. anything that you may need to get to in the area is a little drive away. The beach and bar spots are about a 10-20 minute drive away. There are some fast food places like Burger King & Mc Donalds that are closer but I dont go to PR top eat that junk I can do that at home. To sum things up if you don't know how to get around & you are not familar with the area it is going to be a challenge finding good spots to go to if you want to really enjoy yourself. I had the guide of someone that used to live in the area so things were easy to find. If you are looking for a place to stay were you can go party this is not the place to stay. If you are with family or have kids this is place is OK they have a little play ground as well as a small game room & small gym room. If you go be careful driving some of the locals drive kinda wild.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: kiraly76
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening; the staff at the front desk was o.k. Room was in the second floor of an old, but pretty building. Upon opening the door, the room smelled moldy like it hadn't been opened in a few days. The a/c termostat had to be operated with the door key, even then, it was not working properly as the temperature did not go bellow 74F. The bathroom was clean, but the toilet would not flush. Front desk was called and replied that the maintenance crew was not working until 10:00 P.M. Needless to say, they didn't make it to the room until the next morning. They looked at it and called it "fixed", it never worked. To eat, you have to fill a paper saying the dish you will have for lunch or dinner a few hours before; if you don't, they won't have a meal for you. The "gym" is a really small room with a 2-person sauna, a treadmill, and a machine that if you know a little bit about fitness, just by looking at it you'll know it's useless. Other than the pool, there is absolutely nothing to do or see close to the hotel. By the way, watch out for the mosquitoes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic but not much to do around”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraDeBoston
Reviews.Content: We were in PR during off-season and got the smallest room for a couple. Thus, the value was just right. I would not have paid more than what we paid though ($140). The parador has its own personality, which I really appreciated. It really looks 1920s inside and out, and I loved it. The food was average. There is a refrigerator in the room, so we took care of our own breakfast, which saved us money. We stayed for 2 nights and had plenty of time to go to the nearby Guanica Forest (go early in the morning before the heat wave!), checked out the beaches. Do not go to the one in the town center, rather go to the one near Copa Marina. You won' really be able to find deserted beaches - there are people everywhere. Personnel was nice, but not helpful in terms of the kind of activities we can do in the area. We rented a car and had a GPS which saved us! (though... one can't really get lost on the island)

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Sleep In Late”
Reviews.Author: teacherHUMACAO
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice to relax stayed two nights. Was awoken first day with thuds at 6 A.M. they were fixing roof till 9 P.M following day at 7 A.M they should have moved us. Husband did not let me complain. Over all good service, good food but i would not get the all inclusive small portions , might as well go out for food.Yea i would stay there again but would not get all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “DID NOT STAY here. given one rate with card and upon checkin different”
Reviews.Author: goswimtoday
Reviews.Content: Called in for rate quote. GIven 342 for one night with 2 adults and three kids with b, l, and d. Told not available for room only, we had to go with all inclusive. Ok but upon arrival we were told it was going to be 400+. Told we could stay in one room for 297+ with only lunch and breakfast using an air mattress. DO NOT BELIEVE WHAT THEY SAY. We left and went elsewhere and I hope to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for 1-2 nights”
Reviews.Author: nesi1129
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to PR for a few years & this was my husband's & daughter's first time. I have family in Ensenada & Guanica so we decided to stay here while we visited them. Very convenient. We have traveled alot & are used to big hotel rooms & great food, so I was a little disappointed. Complaining didn't get us anywhere either. The room was very, very small for the three of us & the bathroom was just tiny. No bathtub so I couldn't give my 3 yr old a bath, she's wasn't too fond of showers then. We couldn't have us three & my parents in room at same time. It was just too crowded. The grounds were kept clean, but we were not able to use the pool. We had gotten the breakfast option but never used it, won't do that again. It's a great location, but if they are using this location for training employees, they need to step it up a bit. One night, we had asked for extra towels & my husband had to go & get them from the front desk because the guy was there all alone. The service just could be alot better. Was impressed when first arrived by looks of place but that was it. Prices were better than Copa Marina but will most likely stay there next time for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Room”
Reviews.Author: srblue
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this Parador one night so we could spend two days doing outdoor activities in the area. It was a great basic room - clean but very small. Not much to do if you are looking for "entertainment" but great if you just need a bed for the night. The service was great and so was the food. Perhaps reviewers who didn't like it aren't used to Puerto Rican food - it is definitely a primarily native menu. Also, remember that meals are supposed to be long and relaxing here so service is a little slower (and you have to ask for the check) but we had no problems. In fact, our waiter was very helpful and told us about a fantastic local beach where we spent the next day snorkeling and had the place almost to ourselves. The hotel is NOT government run and has nothing to do with the hospitality school located next to it. Parking is a breeze (not always the case here), although a short walk from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price, terrible service & food”
Reviews.Author: Traviata5013
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here just to avoid the exhorbitant prices at Copa Marina since we were on a business trip and weren't going to be lounging on the beach. It's fine for sleeping since it's quiet and clean, but there's absolutely nothing to do there. The food was so bad that we decided to eat our meals off premises. It's a gov't. run and they use it to train future hotel workers, so you can imagine how slow and inefficient it is. Check-in was very slow and the young gal could hardly operate the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Maximilian4eva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, Sunday through Tuesday. The grounds are lovely, even more charming than the photos suggest. The location is secluded--a rental car is definitely needed--and very quiet. Guanica is no metropolis, but there are some restaurants (mostly fast food) and a grocery store within driving distance. The hotel is only minutes away from the beach. Ponce is a short 30-40 minute drive. Our room (one king-size bed) was quite small, but very clean. For $85 a night, we felt it was priced appropriately. There was a TV in the room and self-controlled AC. The cafe was closed during our stay, though the hotel did offer a (limited) continental breakfast in the mornings, on what seemed to be a first-come, first-served basis. The staff was friendly, if a bit too laid-back, and we only encountered one problem--upon check-in they couldn't find our reservation. Luckily, I had the confirmation number, so they were able to retrieve my paperwork. (Our reservation information, inexplicably, was at a different hotel location.) This mix-up was easily solved and a minor inconvenience that did not affect the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, historical, convenient”
Reviews.Author: IA_rover
Reviews.Content: Parador Guanica 1929 is definitely not for the resort crowd. However, for those who want quiet, safe lodgings as a jumping off spot for exploring the southwest part of Puerto Rico, this hotel is fine. The rooms are smallish, but in line with other old, historic hotels. The beds are comfortable, the grounds clean and the staff pleasant. We arrived exhausted and missing our luggage after an overnight flight. The manager (Alana) was very helpful. She had our room cleaned and opened for us very early. All of the staff were quite friendly. Using the hotel as a base, we traveled around the area exploring the Guanica dry forest, the Toro Negro cloud forest, and various towns in and around the area. The hotel is on route 3116, which connects to 116 just west of Guanica, and at Ensenada farther west. It's easier to find from the Guanica side, but not tough either way. (Hotels.com's directions were way, way wrong!) The previous reviewers are right, there's not much in the way of restaurants in the area. In general, I was disappointed with food in Puerto Rico. Except for roadside stands (where we had the best food) prices were high, and I didn't find the food all that great. The breakfasts at the hotel were OK, but uninspired. Eggs, ham, a dab of mashed potatoes with sofrito, toast, and a tiny wedge of watermelon. I had fantasized about mounds of tropical fruits, and never found anything resembling my dreams. Somehow, white bread toast and Kraft jelly doesn't cut it. They don't start serving breakfast until fairly late in the morning, too. This meant that we didn't get on the road to our next adventure until nearly 10:00 most days. It gets hot quickly in this part of the island. There are generators on the property, as there are on many isolated business properties in the area. There was a power outage one morning. They fired up the generator, and we had power again within a minute. Other than the one or two hours that the generator ran during the outage, the electricity was on and the generators silent. We visited with the owner of the hotel one morning towards the end of our stay. He also owns two properties on the east end of the island. He offered to transfer our last pre-paid day to one of the other hotels so we could go to El Yunque (the national park on the east end of the island). Although this option is not evident on Hotels.com, they are quite willing to transfer. The menu at the other hotel was exactly the same. Bottom line, you get a quiet, safe place to stay while you explore the area. We felt like we were the only guests there - we only saw a handful of other people the entire time we stayed at Parador Guanica 1929. I would go back and stay again to continue to explore the area. I might try to opt out of the breakfast, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for a weekend, and it was better than I expected. We took the all inclusive package and the food was nice; acctually when you took breakfast they make your reservation for lunch,then at lunch they made your reservation for dinner so when you came you dont have to wait to long.The rooms were a little small but comfortable,also very clean.The pool was nice too. I think they already fix the electricity problem because they weren't using the noisy generators that I read in another review.Has a great location for the southwest attractions of the island. We recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “HG 1929 is a lovely spot for independent travellers...”
Reviews.Author: elgato601
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for travellers who are self-sufficient - there is nothing happening in Guanica or the surrounding towns. We loved the "off the beaten track" location - near some gorgeous beaches and 40 minutes from both Ponce and the West Coast of PR. The local restaurants and taverns are not likely gathering spots for tourists... HG 1929 is a historic property, leased to the owner/operator with some bureaucratic stumbling blocks. The electrical rewiring is waiting for PR government certification, and the generator that was to be on site for 30 days has been noisly operating for 1 yr. The guest room windows cannot be replaced, and they can't be opened either. This gives the small rooms a cell-like quality, a shame given the nice and comfortable furnishings, modern bathroom, and efficient A/C. The staff is bilingual and lovely. Paradores feature on site restaurants, and HG 1929 has a pleasant indoor/outdoor cafe on the property. We don't agree with previous reviewers who claim it is the "worst food on the plantet," but having stayed in two properties owned by this family, we are glad we did not opt for the inclusive packages. The food is adequate, but not worth the ala carte prices. Take a pass on the food, and enjoy this beautiful location as a launching point for exploration of southwestern PR.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty buiding, nice people, very clean, worst food on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Ron K
Reviews.Content: Lovely old colonial building, beautiful elgant setting, 15 minute drive to nice beaches. Do not eat dinner there. The menu is lovely but they cannot cook, it is the worst food I've ever eaten. They actually brought me a frozen fish from the kitchen to show me. It was served as a meal seven minutes later. It had either been microwaved or boiled. It tasted like wet wood. Great price, very clean place, stay there but eat elsewhere. Breakfast is tolerable. There is a very noisy generator so eating on the patio is tough, and make sure your room is away from that generator or you'll be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Berkeley_travel
Reviews.Content: I used the reviews from this site and two others and decided to stay at the Inn. On the positive side, the Inn is centrally located if you want to see the south west part of the Island. In addition, the room was spartan but clean. On the flip side, the staff were slow, unhappy, and did a very poor job making up the room (we stayed three nights). In addition, the restaurant and its food were deplorable. The service was slow (had to wait 45 minutes once seated to get menus). Once the food arrived it was inedible. We are not finicky eaters, but the fish smelled putrid. Give this place a miss!
